channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2023080172
item.description:
Report X-2023080172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap came loose, and the liquid leaked. The package was then placed into a bin. DescribePack: The package failed due to the cap becoming loose from one of the bottles and leaked into the package. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was then placed into a red hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023080159
item.description:
Report X-2023080159

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents placed in pkg with no packing material allowing the contents to move freely causing damage and release of liquid contents wetting the contents and carton. Upon discovery the unmarked pkg was placed in a unauthorized unlined plastic bin and sent to QA where it was later transferred to the Hazmat Processing Area by trained personnel. DescribePack: Missing cap on 1 x 1 plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report E-2023070944
item.description:
Report E-2023070944

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the lid was loose on one of the metal 55 gallon drum of nitroethane (un2842) and that 1 cup of product was released. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
